summary: The International Nuclear Energy Act of 2025 aims to boost U.S. leadership in the global civil nuclear energy market. It establishes a White House office to coordinate civil nuclear export policy and strategy. The bill also creates a Nuclear Exports Working Group to develop a 10-year trade strategy. It promotes cooperation with allies, including financing and research initiatives for advanced nuclear reactors, and provides support for embarking civil nuclear nations. Additionally, the bill amends the Energy Policy Act of 2005 to foster international civil nuclear cooperation and establishes a joint assessment with India regarding nuclear liability rules.
